original_title: Indians, Outlaws, Marshals and the Hangin' Judge
overview: Indians, Outlaws, Marshals and the Hangin’ Judge is a story set in the late 19th Century, with topics that resonate today: racial bias, gun violence, Indian affairs and accusations of police brutality. It’s the colorful story of Indian removal, crime, capital punishment and an infamous federal judge who sentenced scores of felons to “hang by the neck until you are dead.”
title: Indians, Outlaws, Marshals and the Hangin' Judge
